channel.title: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please
channel.description:
http://youtube.com/watch?v=wmmJC5l1KZk Kk well I'm trying to connect to xbox live. I've heard of connecting an ethernet cable to your laptop with wireless internet so you won't have to buy that damn $100 wireless adapter for your xbox. So I googled and found all the video above that I posted the link to. It looks very simple to do, but I have a little problem....
At about [i]2:30[/i] in the video, where it tells you to click on the shared tab, well I don't have one of those lol. All I have is the first tab. Any suggestions on how to fix this is greatly appreciated.
~Mjordan~

item.title: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

[quote=“Martin, post:23, topic:161931”]Enable it. Make sure its not being shared. Disable it again. Sorry for a late reply. :P[/quote]Alrighty it’s np, I’ll try that.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

[quote=“Martin, post:21, topic:161931”][quote author=mjordan link=topic=220311.msg1912773#msg1912773 date=1196742703]

Try right clicking your wireless icon on the tab, and go to “networking and sharing center”
and explore that?

lol, just an idea.
[/quote]Yeah thats where all this is happening at man lol. Sorry but read next time.
Thanks for attempting to help though

Make sure NO other connections are also being shared. Even if they are disabled, make sure the box is unticked.[/quote]My dads at work with the laptop right now, but if that words man I’m gonna love you forever lol! I would ++rep you if I could!!! I’ll report back and tell you if it works.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 04, 2007, 06:11:04 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Martin, post:21, topic:161931”]Make sure NO other connections are also being shared. Even if they are disabled, make sure the box is unticked.[/quote]sorry to double post, but how would I go about turning off the shared thing on my disabled LAN?

Read full topic
item.source: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please

item.title: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please
item.dc:creator: @Martin Martin
item.description:
@Martin wrote:

[quote=“mjordan, post:20, topic:161931”][quote author=Casey. link=topic=220311.msg1911411#msg1911411 date=1196662362]
Try right clicking your wireless icon on the tab, and go to “networking and sharing center”
and explore that?

lol, just an idea.
[/quote]Yeah thats where all this is happening at man lol. Sorry but read next time.
Thanks for attempting to help though :)[/quote]

Make sure NO other connections are also being shared. Even if they are disabled, make sure the box is unticked.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

[quote=“leader, post:17, topic:161931”]You need to go to network connections > click on the wireless connection > properties > advanced > allow others to use connection (or something like that).[/quote]Thats the problem lol, there IS no advanced or shared tab…

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

You need to go to network connections > click on the wireless connection > properties > advanced > allow others to use connection (or something like that).

item.title: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:15, topic:161931”]I really have no clue. I mean the guy on youtube is on home premium also… wtfisdisshiz.[/quote]Well damn, I tried all last night and couldn’t figure it out. The disabled Local Access thing has the shared tab but my wireless connection doesn’t. Does it matter that my main computer isn’t wireless? It’s an old Dell desktop connected to the router. And all it has under the network crap is that local access thing.

Read full topic

@xxlegitxx, as of right now my dad doesn’t want me to install XP on the laptop cause it’s his for work. But he can’t do somethings on vista that he can on XP so I might install it sometime.
I’m on the admin account, and I’m using vista home premium. So any ideas man?[/quote]

I really have no clue. I mean the guy on youtube is on home premium also… wtfisdisshiz.

item.description:

http://www.i-tech.com.au/items.aspx?id=4870

second of all, he is saying his computer is upstairs, and can’t run an ethernet cable, so thats why i told him how i do it.
[/quote]

He doesn’t want to buy anything. Another wireless access point would cost more than a wireless adapter. Use some fucking common sense.[/quote] They go for $50-$200. So, yes your right. It would be cheaper.

item.source: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please

item.title: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please
item.dc:creator: @1_dum_taco 1 dum taco
item.description:
@1_dum_taco wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:8, topic:161931”][quote author=1 dum taco link=topic=220311.msg1909500#msg1909500 date=1196585013]
What the hell is that suposed to mean?
[/quote]

It means you don’t know what you’re talking about. Your netgear box thing is called a router. He doesn’t want to buy a separate wireless adapter for his Xbox Live, and a wired connection is out of the question, so he’s trying to find a shared tab on his Vista laptop, to use the laptop as a wireless access point for the internet connection. If you didn’t understand what I said, I wouldn’t be surprised, and just don’t attempt to confuse yourself or anyone else any further. Just watch and learn.[/quote] http://www.i-tech.com.au/items.aspx?id=4870

second of all, he is saying his computer is upstairs, and can’t run an ethernet cable, so thats why i told him how i do it.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please

item.title: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“DeathSkullz, post:9, topic:161931”]Ok I can help.
You need a cable that plugs into the Wireless Router and the Xbox at the same time, with the same type of plug. It looks like a phone-jack. That’s how I got mine to work.

PS: A good game to play on Xbox live is Saints Row[/quote]

Wired is out of the question.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please

item.title: Help with my network connections, for xbox live please
item.dc:creator: @DeathSkullz DeathSkullz
item.description:
@DeathSkullz wrote:

Ok I can help.
You need a cable that plugs into the Wireless Router and the Xbox at the same time, with the same type of plug. It looks like a phone-jack. That’s how I got mine to work.

PS: A good game to play on Xbox live is Saints Row

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

It means you don’t know what you’re talking about. Your netgear box thing is called a router. He doesn’t want to buy a separate wireless adapter for his Xbox Live, and a wired connection is out of the question, so he’s trying to find a shared tab on his Vista laptop, to use the laptop as a wireless access point for the internet connection. If you didn’t understand what I said, I wouldn’t be surprised, and just don’t attempt to confuse yourself or anyone else any further. Just watch and learn.
